This warning system is intended for out door warnings only and may not always be heard in your homes. Note from the Nurse:

We are closely monitoring the flu situation here at school and hoping to keep these yellow jackets healthy. If possible, please have them evaluated by their physician and contact your child's campus with any FLU diagnosis. Any student with a temperature of 100.0 or greater is unable to attend school and will be sent home.

WASHING HANDS IS THE NUMBER ONE WAY TO PREVENT THE SPREAD!

Thanks so much for helping us and I hope that the FLU bug spares your home! If you have any questions please don't hesitate to contact your child's school nurse.

Good morning Boyd ISD. As some of you are aware, we had a false alarm of our "Cop Sync" notification system this morning at 7:49 a.m. at the elementary campus. This was the second "false alarm" we have had in the last two weeks.
The activation of this system, even if it is accidental, automatically activates a district wide "lock down" at all Boyd ISD campuses. Fortunately, we had several police officers already on the Boyd Elementary campus being recognized at our Rise and Shine Assembly. It was quickly determined that the activation was accidental and the lock down was lifted just several minutes later.
Your children's safety is always our highest priority. We will continue to work with the Boyd Police Department and the Wise County Sheriff's Office to make Boyd ISD the safest it can possibly be for all our stakeholders.

Ted West, Superintendent
Boyd ISD
